message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Map<String, List<String>> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
String[] lines = input.split("\n");
for (String line : lines) {
    String[] pairs = line.split(", ");
    for (String pair : pairs) {
        String[] keyValue = pair.split("=");
        map.computeIfAbsent(keyValue[0], k -> new ArrayList<>()).add(keyValue[1]);
    }
}
for (Map.Entry<String, List<String>> entry : map.entrySet()) {
    System.out.println(entry.getKey() + " " + entry.getValue());
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code first splits the input into lines, then each line into key-value pairs. For each pair, it splits it into a key and a value. It then adds the value to the list of values for that key in the map. If the key does not exist in the map, it creates a new list for it. Finally, it prints out the keys and their corresponding lists of values.
